intro: Brachiaria ovalis, commonly known as oval grass, is a perennial grass species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Brachiaria ovalis is often found in disturbed soils and is used for forage in some agricultural systems. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it an important component of grassland ecosystems.
